string-array.name: seleniumBA
string-array.item: In software testing, test automation is the use of test scripts to execute and compare the actual outcomes with predicted outcomes. \n\nThey allow us to regress our products thoroughly with each change and minimal manual intervention.

Every software development group tests its products, yet delivered software always has defects. 

Automated software testing is the best way to increase the effectiveness, efficiency and coverage of your software testing. Automated software testing saves time and money. 

Automated software testing increases test coverage( Lengthy tests that are often avoided during manual testing can be run unattended). 

Automated software testing does what manual testing cannot. ( like running a test suite of 1000 scenarios thrice a week). 

Automated software testing helps developers and testers. (Shared automated tests can be used by developers too).

It is not always advantageous to automate test cases. 

There are times when manual testing may be more appropriate. For instance, if the application’s user interface will change considerably in the near future, then any automation might need to be rewritten anyway. 

If an application has a very tight deadline, there is currently no test automation available, and it’s imperative that the testing get done within that time frame, then generally manual testing is the best solution.

Supports Cross Browser Testing. The Selenium tests can be run on multiple browsers. 

Allows scripting in several languages like Java,Ruby, C#, PHP and Python. 

Tests developed on one browser can be executed on other supported browsers 

Assertion statements provide an efficient way of comparing expected and actual results. 

Selenium is platform and browser independent.

The test types supported are: 

 1. Functional,
 2. Regression,
 3. Load testing


The automation tool could be implemented for post release validation with continuous integration tools like: 

1. Jenkins, 
2. Hudson, 
3. Quick Build 
4. CruiseCont

Selenium Supports only web based applications 

It does not support any non web based (Like Win 32, Java Applet, Java Swing, .Net Client Server etc) applications 

It is an open source tool so in case of any technical issues you need to rely on the selenium community forums to get your issue resolved. 

You need to learn any one of the native language like (.Net, Java, Perl, Python, PHP, Ruby) to work efficiently with the scripting side of selenium 

No inbuilt reporting capability so you need plugins like JUnit and TestNG for test reports. 

Lot of challenges with IE browser.

Selenese or (Selenium set of commands) are categorized into 3 types 

Actions 
 - Actions refer to the set of commands which are used for performing the operations on the application elements 
 - For example the actions commands are like • open, click, clickAndWait, select, type …


Accessors 
 - Accessors are set of commands, which are used for validating the state of the application element and store the result in a variable 
 - For Example: 
 - storeText, storeTextPresent, storeTitle


Assertions 
 - Check points or verification points in Selenium are called as Assertions 
 - For Example: 
 - verifyText, verifyTextPresent, verifyTitle


The Assertions are further classified into 3 types. The check points starts with the keywords: 
 - Verify 
 - Assert 
 - WaitFor

Assert Command 
 - When an "assert" command fails then test execution will be aborted 
 - Assert is best used when the check value has to pass for the test to be able to continue. Like log in to a system. 

Verify Command 
 - When a "verify" command fails then test will continue executing and logging the failure. 
 - Verify is best used to check not so critical verifications like presence of a title or headline element.
